title: The Emblem Of Njorun
opening: Putting down the bandit uprising at Mount Violdrake, Leif's army now sought to join forces with the remnants of Leonster's nobility. Leif set a course for General Hannibal's mountain villa, where the deposed nobles now lived in hiding...

intro.speaker: Travant
intro.line: Is this the area, Merlock?

intro.speaker: Merlock
intro.line: That's correct, sire.

intro.speaker: Travant
intro.line: Hmph... So these bandits are harassing Thracian citizens? Even for your average brigand, that's stupid.

intro.speaker: Altena
intro.line: Exceptionally stupid. Even so, my lord father, you didn't need to come here in person for such a trifle.

intro.speaker: Travant
intro.line: And what kind of king would I be if I wasn't aware of all the matters that trouble my realm, trifling or no? Besides, it's been too long since you and I had an outing of our own, Altena.

intro.speaker: Altena
intro.line: Indeed, Father. I'm glad we were able to spend time together.

intro.speaker: Travant
intro.line: Shame that Arion couldn't join us. I wanted him to come along, but he didn't want the capital to be left unattended in our absence.

intro.speaker: Altena
intro.line: He's merely taking after your example, Father.

intro.speaker: Travant
intro.line: Mm. When I was his age, I'd already taken the throne. Arion needs to keep at it if he wants to outpace me.

intro.speaker: Altena
intro.line: He's doing his best—and so am I. I want only to be a pillar of strength for our family, my lord father.

intro.speaker: Travant
intro.line: Good. The two of you are Thracia's future. The North abounds with crops, and the mountains of the South hide much in the way of resources and riches. An independent Thracia will need both, not just one or the other. To have a single, united Thracia... My fondest wish is to return this land to what it was in the days of Dáinn and Njorun. ...Even if it damns me to the deepest pit of Hell.

intro.speaker: Altena
intro.line: ...Father?

intro.speaker: Travant
intro.line: Altena…

intro.speaker: Altena
intro.line: Yes?

intro.speaker: Travant
intro.line: ...The wind's changing on us. Let's head back and leave this one to Merlock.

intro.speaker: Altena
intro.line: As you wish, my lord father.

intro.speaker: Travant
intro.line: You good to handle this on your own, Merlock?

intro.speaker: Merlock
intro.line: Hah! You insult me by asking, sire!

intro.speaker: Travant
intro.line: All right, then I'm entrusting you with the rest of our soldiers. I won't accept any excuses—wipe out every last bandit. Show them what it's like to have made an enemy of Thracia!

intro.speaker: Merlock
intro.line: Leave everything to me, milord!

intro.speaker: Selphina
intro.line: My lord father! It's the Thracian army! T-They're flooding in from the south!

intro.speaker: Dryas
intro.line: So Travant has finally noticed us... A pox on it all! With Glade in Tarrah, there's no one here with any experience in battle...

intro.speaker: Selphina
intro.line: Then leave it to me. I'll draw their attention and buy everyone time to escape.

intro.speaker: Dryas
intro.line: Wait! General Hannibal sent word ahead. According to him, Prince Leif and a coalition of warriors from Fiana and Munster are already en route. We have to hold out until they get here...

intro.speaker: Selphina
intro.line: Understood. If you've no objections, I'll establish a defensive perimeter. Cain! Alva! Robert! We're moving out! Follow me!

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: The villa is just ahead, Prince Leif.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: Is something amiss? Those soldiers moving about, are they Duke Dryas' troops?

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: Hm? Blast...! Take a closer look at their armor, Prince Leif—that's the Thracian army!

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: Wh-What?! Wasn't this villa supposed to be under the protection of General Hannibal?

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: Perhaps Thracia finally learned of their presence, or perhaps General Hannibal tipped them off...

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: I'll not hear it, August! General Hannibal is a man of honor—he'd not do such a thing!

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: ...Be that as it may, we must move to rescue them immediately! If that villa falls, any hope of liberating Thracia or rebuilding Leonster falls with it!

battle-talk.speaker: Selphina
battle-talk.line: Prince Leif! Oh, it's been too long, milord! It's me, Selphina!

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: Selphina, in the flesh! Can it really be you?

battle-talk.speaker: Selphina
battle-talk.line: Prince Leif... This halfway feels like a dream... When I last saw you, milord, you were but a child, a toddler who fell asleep at my knees... You've grown into such a fine young man...

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: Oh, Selphina, it's enough to make me cry... I had thought you and Duke Dryas were killed trying to protect me. I never imagined I'd be able to see you again. I... never knew my mother or sister. The kinship of family was the one thing my retainers were never able to fetch for me. I saw Lachesis as a sort of mother, and you as the older sister I was never able to meet. Not that I ever showed you much gratitude for it. I remember being quite the little terror...

battle-talk.speaker: Selphina
battle-talk.line: Oh, it would be terribly improper to ever say such a thing of the prince of Leonster. I'll have to take you at your word, milord. I... take it that Lady Lachesis still has yet to return?

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: I'm afraid so... She... never made it back from her excursion to Isaach.

battle-talk.speaker: Selphina
battle-talk.line: I see... Well, don't give up hope. It's still possible that she's alive somewhere—alive and happy. I'm sure you'll find her someday, Prince Leif. After all, the two of us were able to meet again, were we not?

battle-talk.speaker: Selphina
battle-talk.line: Sir Finn! It's been too long.

battle-talk.speaker: Finn
battle-talk.line: Hold! Are you friend or enemy?

battle-talk.speaker: Selphina
battle-talk.line: Have you forgotten me already, Sir Finn? It's Selphina!

battle-talk.speaker: Finn
battle-talk.line: Selphina? Duke Dryas' daughter?!

battle-talk.speaker: Selphina
battle-talk.line: The very same.

battle-talk.speaker: Finn
battle-talk.line: You don't say... When last we met, you still wore your hair in braids...

battle-talk.speaker: Selphina
battle-talk.line: I can only hope I'm more of a proper woman now than I was a decade past. Glade and I have since been wed, you see.

battle-talk.speaker: Finn
battle-talk.line: Glade?! That old dog! How's he been? Ah, we've much catching up to do—you must take me to him at once!

battle-talk.speaker: Selphina
battle-talk.line: Your reunion will have to wait a little longer, I'm afraid. He's away in Tarrah, trying to aid the city's defenders.

battle-talk.speaker: Finn
battle-talk.line: A pity... Still, if duty calls, I suppose it can't be helped.

battle-talk.speaker: Selphina
battle-talk.line: Hmph. You can barely hide your excitement for seeing my husband, but you can't scrape together two words for my benefit. I see you haven't changed much—no regard for the feelings of women.

battle-talk.speaker: Finn
battle-talk.line: Th-That's uncalled for! I meant nothing by it...

battle-talk.speaker: Selphina
battle-talk.line: Oh? But I still remember how you abandoned Lady Lachesis—left her to go off on her own. The sorrow was plain as day upon her face, but you let her walk away.

battle-talk.speaker: Finn
battle-talk.line: I... I'm not sure what you mean...

battle-talk.speaker: Selphina
battle-talk.line: No, I know you understand, Sir Finn—but you pretend not to!

battle-talk.speaker: Finn
battle-talk.line: ...Selphina, we've just met again for the first time in a decade. There's no need to get into this now.

battle-talk.speaker: Selphina
battle-talk.line: Ah... I apologize. You've the right of it. It was more than rude of me to ambush you like that after such a long absence...

battle-talk.speaker: Finn
battle-talk.line: No, I... I understand. We can... talk about it later. For now, the battlefield calls.

battle-talk.speaker: Selphina
battle-talk.line: ...Of course, Sir Finn.

battle-talk.speaker: Carrion
battle-talk.line: Lady Selphina, I made it back!

battle-talk.speaker: Selphina
battle-talk.line: Oh, my dear Carrion! Thank you for all that you've done.

battle-talk.speaker: Carrion
battle-talk.line: Think nothing of it, milady. Would that I could've done more... Ah, I must double my training if I'm to become as strong a knight as Sir Glade sometime in my natural life! I want only to aid Prince Leif, but all I've learned in his service so far is just how powerless I truly am...

battle-talk.speaker: Selphina
battle-talk.line: Don't let your impatience cloud your judgment. You won't be of any use to him dead. Hmm... The time to grant you your inheritance may have come more quickly than I'd thought.

battle-talk.speaker: Carrion
battle-talk.line: Inheritance? Th-This is... a fine blade, milady, but where—

battle-talk.speaker: Selphina
battle-talk.line: Your mother entrusted this to me. It's known as the Elite Sword. She bade me give it to you when you had grown into a worthy knight.

battle-talk.speaker: Carrion
battle-talk.line: M-Mother?!

battle-talk.speaker: Selphina
battle-talk.line: She passed from this world far too young, taken by illness. A tragedy if ever there was one, that... This very blade was a favorite of your father's, and he wielded it right up until the day he died honorably in battle.

battle-talk.speaker: Carrion
battle-talk.line: F-Father's own blade... that he wielded in service of House Leonster...!

battle-talk.speaker: Selphina
battle-talk.line: This is your birthright, Carrion—use it with great care.

battle-talk.speaker: Carrion
battle-talk.line: Y-Yes, I will! Thank you, Lady Selphina!

battle.speaker: August
battle.line: Prince Leif, I've dire news! I... I regret to report that the villa... has fallen.

battle.speaker: August
battle.line: All that remained of Leonster's nobility had taken refuge here... Now, they have joined their kingdom in oblivion. Without them, I'm afraid there is... no longer any hope of reconstituting Leonster...

boss.speaker: Merlock
boss.line: Y-You're no common bandit! What's going on here?!

boss.speaker: Merlock
boss.line: F-Forgive me, King Travant, Your Majesty...

end.speaker: Dryas
end.line: Prince Leif...! To be able to see you, safe and healthy, after all these years... You've... grown into quite the splendid young man.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Whatever I've accomplished, I owe to you and Finn. Without your sacrifices, I never could've come as far as I have...

end.speaker: Dryas
end.line: ...Oh, this is most unbecoming! Confound it... I... I, ah... I suppose I've become easier to move to tears in my age.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: ...Duke Dryas, I think you've earned— Ah! Y-Your arm! Don't tell me you...

end.speaker: Dryas
end.line: Oh, this? Bah! It's but a trifle. I... grew careless during the battle for Ulster. The disgrace is mine alone to bear.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: At Ulster? Then... it was for the sake of ensuring my escape... Dammit! Is that what it always comes down to?! How many more people have to sacrifice themselves just to save me? How many?! Even you, Dryas... All for me...

end.speaker: Dryas
end.line: Hah! Don't let this, of all things, weigh heavily upon your heart, Prince Leif. Even supposing I wasn't injured, an old dotard like me would hardly be of any use to you now. Let us not allow our minds to linger on past wounds—we've much work to do yet. I understand you wish to aid Tarrah. I mean to do the same, but we've precious little time to act. I've sent Glade ahead to the city. We've gotten word back from him, and he reports that the Empire means to mount an all-out assault against Tarrah perilously soon. With you and your forces here, every brave soul in Thracia now stands assembled beneath the banner of Njorun. The reborn kingdom of Leonster must be unleashed upon the front lines—starting with the Thracian soldiers amassed outside!

end.speaker: August
end.line: Regarding that... the Thracian troops seem to have ceased attacking. Most curious...

end.speaker: Dryas
end.line: I'll start coming up with a plan. Give me a moment to get a better look at this strange state of affairs, Prince Leif.

end.speaker: Dryas
end.line: Hmm... Leif's man was right. They have indeed called off their attack... But why? ...Who in blazes is that? That Dracoknight—a woman, by the look of it—what's she saying to the Thracian troops? Some kind of declaration?

end.speaker: Altena
end.line: All soldiers of Thracia, heed me! This is your princess, Altena! I bring word from General Hannibal himself! The men in that villa are not bandits—they're a mercenary unit the General has stationed here to PROTECT this area from bandits! Sheathe your swords! Withdraw at once!
